alert.note: Alert for Chester; Decatur; Hardin; Henderson; McNairy (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 24 at 3:33PM CST until February 24 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of West Tennessee, including the following areas, Benton TN, Carroll, Chester, Crockett, Decatur, Fayette, Hardeman, Hardin, Haywood, Henderson, Madison, McNairy and Shelby. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - 2 to 4 inches of rainfall has fallen across the watch area over the past 48 hours. Any additional rainfall today and tonight may result in flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
